intro: Melocactus tephracanthus, commonly known as the Mexican torch cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, cylindrical stems that can grow up to 1.5 meters in height. The plant produces yellow flowers during the summer months, which are followed by red, fleshy fruits. Its thick, waxy cuticle helps it retain water in harsh, dry environments. Melocactus tephracanthus is a slow-growing plant that thrives in full sun and well-draining soil.
